meanings.definition: To make something resemble or conform to the principles or practices of Nazism.
meanings.sent1: The dictator nazifies the country by imposing strict censorship and propaganda.
meanings.sent2: The extremist group nazifies their ideology by promoting hate and discrimination.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously nazifies a fictional world where everyone wears the same uniform.
meanings.sent4: The artist metaphorically nazifies the canvas with bold red and black colors representing oppression.
meanings.sent5: The teacher uses a creative activity to vividly nazify the classroom with symbols of dictatorship.

meanings.definition: To subject to the principles or practices of Nazism.
meanings.sent1: The invading army nazifies the captured territories, imposing their ideology on the locals.
meanings.sent2: The propaganda campaign nazifies the minds of the population, spreading hatred and intolerance.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully nazify their game by pretending to be strict rulers of a make-believe empire.
meanings.sent4: The dark cloud of war metaphorically nazifies the peaceful landscape, changing it forever.
meanings.sent5: The documentary film uses real footage to vividly nazify the atrocities committed during the war.
